content:
Sure, here's a story about what might happen when the five play Project Zomboid later:

The five students met up at the Sussex student's house to play Project Zomboid. The Falmouth student, who had been looking forward to the game all week, arrived early and started setting up the game. The Oxford student, who had been busy with classes, arrived a little later, looking a bit tired but excited to play. The security guard, who had never played the game before, arrived with a bag of snacks, ready to learn. And the supermarket assistant, who had been playing the game on their own, arrived last and immediately started bragging about their skills.

As they all settled in and started playing, things quickly got intense. The zombies were everywhere, and the group had to work together to stay alive. The Sussex student, who had been distracted by their phone, accidentally led a group of zombies right to their location. The Falmouth student, who had been talking too much, accidentally alerted more zombies with their loud voice. The Oxford student, who had been too focused on killing zombies, accidentally shot the security guard in the game, mistaking them for a zombie.

Despite these setbacks, the group managed to stay alive and make it through the game. The security guard, who had been a quick learner, surprised everyone with their skills, while the Falmouth student, who had been struggling at first, ended up being the one to land the final blow on the final boss. The supermarket assistant, who had been bragging all night, ended up dying early on in the game, but still managed to have fun and contribute to the group.

In the end, the five of them had a great time playing Project Zomboid together, and even made plans to play again soon. They all went home tired but happy, excited to play again and see what adventures awaited them in the game.
